BE it enacted ne the Queen’s Most Excellent Mojesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and the House of Representatives of Ceylon in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows: —
4, This Act may be cited as the Excise (Amend- Shor tite. ment) Act, No. 9 of 1956.

(2) by the addition, at the end of that section, of the following sub-section :—

*(@) Where a person who is bound to give notice under section 40 of this Ordi- Hance is prosecuted for the offence, of intentionally omitting to give such notice in contravention of that section, it shall be presumed, until the contrary is proved, that sach person has intentionally omitted . te give such notice if an excise officer of a rank not below that of Superintendent certifies in writing under his hand, after auch investigation as he may deem neces- . sary, that he is satisfied that such person has omitted to give such notice.”
